name: The Red Spider Project
tagline: Coding and xkcd combined, for fun!
body:
### Wait, what?

Essentially we're writing a heterogenous set of (small, portable, amusing/interesting/touching, possibly interacting, command-line) programs, which may expand continually. We're not working towards a final goal, just enjoying the process. We're open to ideas, programming languages and people. If you like coding and [xkcd](http://xkcd.com) too, please consider joining the project!

### Pointers

If you're full of questions, you might want to read our [wiki](https://github.com/the-xkcd-community/the-red-spider-project/wiki) and perhaps also our [Readme](https://github.com/the-xkcd-community/the-red-spider-project/blob/master/Readme.md). If you wonder who we are or want to introduce yourself or your idea, check out [our thread at the xkcd forums](http://forums.xkcd.com/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=81969). We also have an IRC channel: #redspider at irc.foonetic.net. If you want to help out, please have a look at our [issues](https://github.com/the-xkcd-community/the-red-spider-project/issues).

### Artwork

Joey (aka tidbit) made these splendid logo designs. Let us know what you think at the [forums](http://forums.xkcd.com/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=81969)! The SVG source is in our repository, but note that you need to have the Segoe Print font installed in order to reproduce the images shown here.

![Original: free artist association to "red spider"](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/3512486/rspider.png)
![xkcd-ified design, variant "tapered legs"](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/3512486/rstapered.png)
![xkcd-ified design, variant "noodle legs"](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/3512486/rsnoodle.png)

### About this page

It was last updated on 3. April 2013. The source is in the `gh-pages` branch.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
